name: OccupationClass
title: Occupation Class
description: Occupation Class codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: Professional who prepares, examines, and maintains financial records and statements.
Professional who analyzes financial consequences of risk using mathematics, statistics, and financial theory.
Professional who oversees operations, policies, and strategic direction of an organization or department.
Professional specializing in soil management and crop production science.
Employees working in airline operations, including ground staff and administrative roles.

designation.value: Personnel de compagnie de transport aérien

concept.definition: Professional who designs buildings and structures.
Members of military services.
Individual engaged in creative or performing arts as sole occupation.
Individual who participates in competitive sports at a professional level.
Technician who diagnoses, repairs, and maintains motor vehicles.
Professional engaged in the sale of new or used motor vehicles.
Scientist who studies celestial objects, space, and the physical universe.
Administrative staff in banking and financial institutions handling operational support functions.
Clerical employees in banking and financial institutions performing data entry and customer service tasks.
Managers in banking and financial institutions with oversight of teams and operations.
Professional who cuts, styles, and maintains hair.
Skilled tradesperson who constructs, repairs, and installs building frameworks and structures made from wood and other materials.
Employee who handles payment transactions at retail or service establishments.
Professionally certified accountant holding the CA designation.
Government employee working in public administration.
Religious leader or ordained minister.
Professional working in information technology roles including systems analysis, software development, and technical consulting.
Professional advisor specializing in employee relations, recruitment, and organizational development.
Professional advisor in fields not otherwise specified.
Professional advisor specializing in employee development and training programs.

concept.display: Courts e.g. Bailiff, Clerk, Reporter, Stenographer, etc.
concept.definition: Employees working in judicial settings providing administrative and procedural support.

designation.value: Employé de la Cour, ex. huissier, greffier, rapporteur, sténographe, etc.
Tribunales, ej. Alguacil, Secretario, Reportero, Taquígrafo, etc.

concept.definition: Skilled worker who creates items by hand or with specialized tools.
Employee of a government-owned enterprise.

designation.value: Empleado de Corporación de la Corona

concept.definition: Employee working in gaming and hospitality services at a casino.
Technical and production staff in film, television, or theater.

designation.value: Caméraman, projectionniste, machiniste de plateau, recherchiste

concept.definition: Professional with chartered certification in business administration.
Worker engaged in building, repairing, or demolishing structures.
Trainer who instructs and develops athletes or teams.
Professional who cares for and educates children in a daycare setting.

Professional who provides expert advice on food and nutrition.
Physician who provides primary care across a broad range of health conditions.
Driver who transports goods within a local area.
Driver who transports goods over long distances or performs moving services.

Physician specializing in conditions of the skin, hair, and nails.
Skilled tradesperson who installs, maintains, and repairs electrical systems and equipment.
Licensed professional who applies scientific and mathematical principles to design and develop systems, structures, or processes.

concept.display: Entertainment Field e.g. Actor, Musician, etc.
concept.definition: Professional performer or entertainer in arts and media.

designation.value: Campo de Entretenimiento, ej. Actor, Músico, etc.

concept.definition: Senior professional responsible for strategic decision-making and organizational leadership.
Medical specialist who diagnoses and treats heart rhythm disorders.
Healthcare professional who helps patients develop or recover skills needed for daily living and working.

concept.definition: Manufacturing employee who operates machinery or creates precision tools and dies.

designation.value: Trabajador de Fábrica, Operador de Máquinas, Matricero

concept.definition: Individual who operates agricultural land for crop or livestock production.
Professional who provides financial planning, investment, or economic analysis services.

concept.definition: Cabin crew member who ensures passenger safety and comfort during flights.
